Reviews.Content: View of the Duomo We stayed three nights at this quiet clean hotel. The breakfast room and our room viewed the Duomo about 1/2 kilometer away. We walked to the hotel from the train station each with our wheeled suitcase in 20 minutes. The hotel is located on the 3rd floor. Fortunately we packed lightly hauling up our suitcases. The desk person recomended a local restaurant with few tourists.It was 100 euros per night con picolo colazione.
Reviews.Author: SacramentoStefano

Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel       View from our room
Reviews.Author: Mrssjam

Reviews.Content: Great basic hotel Hotel Cardinal is in central Florence, but you need to catch a taxi to get there as Florence can be difficult to navigate if you are unfamiliar with it. We caught the taxi from the airport, and it cost us 40 euro. The taxi will also drop you off about 10 metres down the road, as the road which the hotel is located on is too narrow for cars.I really loved the area the hotel was in. It was in a residential area and very close to a supermarket. It was also easy walking distance to all tourist attractions.Yes you have to walk up stairs to get to the hotel, but we didn't find this a problem and the staff offered us help with our luggage on arrival. In fact throughout our stay the staff were very polite and helpful.The rooms were modern and very clean. I have stayed in several 2 / 3 star hotels in Italy, and this bathroom was probably the best so far. The rooms were spacious, air conditioned and cleaned daily. I was also impressed with the daily breakfast, which included fruit, cakes, cereal, croissants and freshly brewed coffee.This was one of the cheapest hotels we stayed at in Italy, but was definately the best. For the budget concious traveller I would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Filamena

Reviews.Content: Liked the hospitality Hotel Cardinal is a nice hotel located right behind the Duomo in Florence. The hotel can be reached by a 10 minutes drive by taxi from the Railway station. Its advisable to take a taxi as its difficult to find the place on your own the first time you visit. Besides, its a 20-25 minutes walk from the station so it may be difficult to reach there on foot with luggage and also when travelling with kids. As per the description in the reviews I read, this hotel is located in one of the lanes behind the Duomo in an old 2 storeyed building with 60 steep steps leading to the reception. You may get totally dissappointed when you reach the entrance of the building and climb the steps. We were all girls with a child in our group so didnt hesitate to call the manager at the desk down to pick up our heavy bags. I must mention that the staff here was very friendly and the florentine hospitality was the best that we've seen of the cities visited in Italy. The rooms and bathrooms were neat and clean. This hotel can be inconvenient for older people due to the fact that there was no lift in the hotel building and the location was far from the station. But besides that everything else was perfect. And the best thing about this place is definitely the friendly and helpful staff. This place reminds me of the bed and breakfast places that are found in some parts of UK.
Reviews.Author: sk18

Reviews.Content: In The Heart of Florence       The room
Reviews.Author: Gunnar_OShea

Reviews.Content: The worst we experienced ! After finally finding this hotel and being unable to park our car anywhere, even to deposit the luggage things only got worse...we (myself, 2 young children and my husband) had to haul our luggage up 60 odd steep steps to the 4th floor to reception with no help from anyone at Reception either.Upon checking we were told that even though we had booked for 4 they were only expecting 3 of us ! They had to make up a room for us (drag in another bed). We walked into a bare bones basic room. It was a hot 30 degree day and after hauling up the baggage we were hot but could not get the Air Con to work. They fiddled with it for 1/2 hour but could not work it so said someone would fix it tomorrow (it was only 2pm). There was no fridge, no safe, no air con, no elevator. The batroom was mouldly and dirty looking and the paint was peeling off the hughe cracks in the bedroom walls. Enough !!! We left and went to the Hotel Corona that we had prevously stayed in, which was also rated a 3 star but bigger, better, cheaper and had air con and an elevator !Would not recommend it in any way !
Reviews.Author: carinaMelbourne

Reviews.Content: Liked the Hotel! I booked the hotel mainly for its location and after having read the reviews by other travellers (on tripadvisor) I was quite worried, I have to say. However, the stay at this hotel turned out to be a very good one indeed. Our room was very nicely furnished, very roomy, it had a very good bathroom, a TV and airconditioning (which could be regulated by us). There are indeed 66 steps to get to it but once you go up the steps, it was indeed worth the while. The location is superb as it is close to some great restaurants and within easy walking distance (as little as two minutes) to Florence's best sites including Piazzale Michelangelo (some 20 - 25 minutes without stops). On our arrival we were greated by the reception who helped us with our suitcases and breakfast was what one expects from a 3-star hotel in Italy. Overall, great value (we booked through the [--]site) and great location. We would definitely consider this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: Firefly1977

Reviews.Content: Lovely People I went with a friend for a long weekend in October, it was the first time we had gone away without adults but had both been to florence before, but naturally wanted to be in the centre! This hotel did not disappoint, we were right next to the Duomo up a very lovely Italian street, its just what you want! The stairs did become slightly frustrating walking up them, but if we can do it, then anyone can, and we did get some help from the desk!The breakfast was not good although the coffee was amazing, but the small cafes around the hotel serve nice food, but tend to get very busy!If you want to enjoy Florence with convenience then this hotel if perfect, close to everything and reasonably priced! The desk was a group of very friendly Italian men who gave us information and helped with any problems which we had!All in all, a very pleasant stay
Reviews.Author: ThisCharmingGirl

Reviews.Content: hotel Again - the stairs are a problem - they really need a lift - I left at 6am with only one man on reception he didn't help me down with my bags.Walls very thin!! You can not only hear conversations but tvs, bathroom water running. However, It was modern and clean and staff in general were friendly. I stay in Janurary for Winter break - however on arrive there were many litlle flying insects in my room - I complained and was told they dont have mosy's this time of year! Well I dont know what they were then. I stayed for a week and had to get rid of these insects myself- I realised they were coming in when the maid opened the window after cleaning. I dont know what thats all about and know that the hotel can't stop that but they could at leas spray insect killer - as not everyone likes to see's them of the walls.In the end I asked them to instruct the maid to leave the window closed which she did then it was fine!Don't know what thats about - maybe time of year but wanted to warn others just in case.Brill location though so close to all attractions and 20 min walk to station- Although dont try it with a case as roads in Florence aren't that smooth.Nicely decorated rooms -very modern and bathrooms are clean and nice decor.
Reviews.Author: HoneyLondon

Reviews.Content: Disappointed in Hotel Cardinal, Florenc Stayed with my wife and 2 teenage sons. Rooms were recently painted and hotel building was in good shape. Location was only 10 minutes walk from the duomo, so that part was good.The bed was the worst we had in Italy - and that's saying something! The hotel is 60 odd steps up a narrow staircase and there's no elevator. Don't stay here if you have joint problems or are not in good shape. The breakfast was VERY limited. No meats, no cheese, no fruits, had to buy capaccino. Had 2 cereals but had to ask for milk to go with it. Asked for an extra pillow twice on the first day -which was never delivered.
Reviews.Author: warmawr

Reviews.Content: Good Location, that is Our family stayed there for 2 nights in Sep 2006. Location is good, only costs 10 Euros taxi from train station. But the road is closed for traffic so we had to carry the luggage to walk for few minutes then climbed up the stairs. We did get some help from the staff.The Location is excellent, walk to major highlights. Breakfast is poor, better go to cafe to have itNo room cleaning on the second day.Perhaps try to book other 3 stars hotels
Reviews.Author: Kct1223

Reviews.Content: Great hotel We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon for 2 nights in Sept 06, and found the hotel to be great!! We were in room 330 that had pretty views of the neighbouring buildings and trees. The hotel was clean, modern and very conveniently located. It was also reasonably priced at 119 euros per night. The room had aircon, a TV and a small juliet balcony. It wasn't a huge room, but it was comfortable.The staff at the hotel offered very good service, and were always happy to help. They also let us store some food in the fridge in the kitchen, and gave us advice about tourist attractions to visit.The negatives associated with this hotel were that at certain times we could hear the people talking in the bathroom of the room next door, although this was fairly infrequent.We also had to climb several flights of stairs to get up to the hotel, but the receptionist offered to help us with our baggage because we rang the intercom from the street. It wasn't an issue for us though, we didn't mind the stairs, because we got a bit of a view from the room, due to the height of the hotel. The breakfast was limited, but sufficient.
Reviews.Author: SydneyBek

Reviews.Content: What roof terrace As previous reviews have stated there are a lot of stairs up to the hotel, but we did get help from the receptionist.Our problems were that the rooms are quite small and the hotel is quite noisy,we were the furthest away from the breakfast room but we could still hear the coffee grinder from 7am!The roof terrace is up a small staircase just around the corner from the breakfast room,but look for it as it looks just like a second level to more rooms which it is.Anothe rstaircase!! leads to a locked door that would lead to the terrace but that was never open so we did not see the view of Florence we expected.The receptionist told us that it was not open and never gave an explanation.The bar also remained closed during our stay and again we were told that it was just not open.In fairness, a nice hotel in a perfect position for exploring Florence let down by the staff. BUT we advise anybody in Florence to seek out the Borga Antico restaurant in Piazza Santo Spirito which serves great food in huge portions at great prices in a superb atmosphere inside or out. Be aware that outside you may find that you share a table with other guests but that just adds to the brillinat ambience of this superb restaurant.GO AND FIND IT
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel great location
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 66 stairs up no elevator no help We should have been advised that the hotel was on the fourth floor,66 steps up.There was no help with luggage. Rooms were barely adequate,beds uncomfotable.We were told they would secure tickets to the Uffizi Gallery when we arrived,instead they were no help at all,.All in all.no elevator,no service, a very bad experience.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: a lovely surprise! I was looking for a cheap hotel in the middle of Florence, and that is exactly what I got. It was about 100 euros for a double room for 3 nights, which was amazing value. The place is on the top floor, so yes, the stairs are a hassle, but how much luggage do you take for 3 nights? If you have heavy bags or mobility difficulties, I don't recommend it. Had just been refurbished, very stylish, basic but cool - red curtains, white wall, black leather headboard. Perfect location - 10/15 mins walk from train station but just a couple of mins from the Duomo - we could see it from our room! Is on a pedestrianised street so a lot quieter than most places I've stayed in Florence. Walls are quite thin however so i can see it would be noisy if the people next door were. Very clean, sheets were changed every morning, adequate bathroom with shower cubicle. In short, cheapish, basic, central, stylish. Cost the same as a more hostel type place i had visited a few weeks earlier, but infinitely nicer. Dont know about food because not up early enough (also i dont think it was in the price) but theres a million nice cafes about.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ace location but a poor night's sleep While the location is certainly phenomenal for exploring the major sights, the area is very noisy at night. The staff was alright but not terribly helpful, and the temperature controls in the room were way off. Don't bother with the lackluster breakfast, especially as there are so many good caffes within walking distance. I probably wouldn't stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, lots of steps though! This hotel was a real value on my latest trip to Italy. My room had a great view of the Duomo and was just a 5 minute walk from it. The room was small but recently renovated and extremely clean. My only gripe about the hotel was its location on the fourth floor of the building. Bringing luggage up without an elevator was extremely tiring. This hotel has an arrangement with a garage just down the street who will pick up and drop your car off for you. Those who have driven in Florence will appreciate that huge benefit.
Reviews.Author: dsanmarco
